sn17.11:4.4: When I’ve comprehended the mind of a certain person, I understand:
sn17.11:4.5: ‘This venerable would not tell a deliberate lie even for the sake of a golden bowl filled with silver dust.’
sn17.11:4.6: But some time later I see them tell a deliberate lie because their mind is overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.
sn17.11:4.7: That’s how brutal, bitter, and harsh are possessions, honor, and popularity. …”
